instructions: 1. Flatten the chicken breasts with a meat mallet until they are thin, but not overly so.
2. Prepare three plates: one with flour, one with a beaten egg, and one with seasoned breadcrumbs.
3. Dredge each piece of chicken in the flour, then dip it into the egg, and finally coat it with the seasoned breadcrumbs.
4. Fry the coated chicken in hot oil until golden brown, being careful not to let the oil get too hot.
notes: This dish is a beloved staple in Tunisian-Djerban Jewish cuisine, often served with a side of salad or potatoes.
